title: How To Train Your Dog To Walk On A Leash
summary: A leash is long enough to give you enough room to walk comfortably but short enough so that it doesn’t drag on the ground when you’re not holding it. A crate can be a great place for your dog to rest, especially when you're training them to walk on a leash. The best way to train your dog is to use a “heel” command to keep them closer to you and prevent them from becoming a nuisance around other people and dogs.

You may already have a few of the below listed items, but it\u2019s a good idea to check that everything is in good condition and ready to be used."),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Leash - Get a leash that is long enough to give you enough room to walk comfortably but short enough so that it doesn\u2019t drag on the ground when you\u2019re not holding it."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Crate - A crate can be a great place for your dog to rest, especially when you\u2019re training them to walk on a leash."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Treats - While any snacks will do, certain treats are actually designed to help with dog training."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Clicker - This device is designed to mark a desired behaviour, like your dog sitting or staying put.")),mdx("h2",null,"Start Outside"),mdx("p",null,"Before you ever bring your dog indoors to walk with you on a leash, you should start your training outside. There are a few reasons for this, but it\u2019s best to start off with a foundation of positive associations before moving to more stressful environments. A sidewalk or patch of grass will work fine for this stage of training."),mdx("p",null,"First, you want to get your dog accustomed to the feel of the leash. You can let your dog sniff and get used to the leash while they are still attached to you. If they seem frustrated or upset by the leash, you should try a different type of collar. If you start out with a negative association with the leash, your dog is much more likely to be fearful and hesitant whenever they are outside with the leash on."),mdx("h2",null,"Teach \u201CCome\u201D Command"),mdx("p",null,"For an indoor training session, start off by teaching your dog the \u201Ccome\u201D command. This is a useful command to have in case your dog ever gets loose or starts to get aggressive around other dogs or people. You\u2019ll want to keep your training indoors until your dog is completely comfortable outside with the leash on."),mdx("p",null,"To start, begin by holding a treat in your hand, palm facing your dog. Let them sniff the treat and, if they try to take the treat, say the word \u201Ccome.\u201D This is the noise you want your dog to associate with the treat, so keep saying it each time you give them a treat. They may not catch on right away, but they will catch on eventually. "),mdx("h2",null,"Before You Walk Together"),mdx("p",null,"Before you ever head outside with your dog and the leash attached, it\u2019s important to let them get used to wearing the collar. Again, if they seem frustrated or scared, try a different collar before moving on to the next step of the training. Putting the collar on them and letting them walk around the house with it on for about five minutes a day for a week will help ease them into the feeling of wearing it."),mdx("p",null,"The best way to do this is to put the collar on them, let them walk around the house for a few minutes, and then take it off. Don\u2019t ever leave the collar on them while they are sleeping or unattended."),mdx("h2",null,"Train \u201CHeel\u201D Command"),mdx("p",null,"The best way to train your dog to walk by your side is to use a \u201Cheel\u201D command. This is a very useful tip when walking your dog around other people and dogs since it will keep them closer to you and prevent them from becoming a nuisance. You\u2019ll want to start off with your dog wearing the collar and the leash on."),mdx("p",null,"For this part of the training, you can either walk around your yard or walk in a wide open area where there is little to no human or dog traffic. When you start walking, start with a slow pace and keep a consistent rhythm. As your dog begins to walk with you, say the word \u201Cheel\u201D and gently tug on the leash to encourage them to walk beside you."),mdx("h2",null,"Important Note"),mdx("p",null,"When training your dog to walk on a leash, be certain to keep things positive and consistent. Avoid sudden jerking on their collar or using punishing tones. If you remain consistent, you will see results in no time. Dogs can be a great walking companion, but only if you take the time to properly train them."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Putting your dog in a boarding facility or kennel isn\u2019t an easy decision for most pet owners, especially if you have a sensitive breed (i.e., lots of barking = unhappy dogs). So how can you get your pup ready to be on their own? It\u2019s not as simple as locking them in a closet for a few hours once or twice and then expecting them to be cool with it. Dogs don\u2019t think like people; they don\u2019t understand symbolic actions like turning off the light as meaning that you won\u2019t be coming back home tonight. They have instinctual fear responses that need to be addressed specifically with training and care before leaving them alone.'))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Not Beg at the Table

var u=Object.defineProperty,g=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(t,o,e)=>o in t?u(t,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:e}):t[o]=e,i=(t,o)=>{for(var e in o||(o={}))r.call(o,e)&&h(t,e,o[e]);if(n)for(var e of n(o))s.call(o,e)&&h(t,e,o[e]);return t},l=(t,o)=>g(t,c(o));var d=(t,o)=>{var e={};for(var a in t)r.call(t,a)&&o.indexOf(a)<0&&(e[a]=t[a]);if(t!=null&&n)for(var a of n(t))o.indexOf(a)<0&&s.call(t,a)&&(e[a]=t[a]);return e};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(e){var a=e,{components:t}=a,o=d(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(i(i({},layoutProps),o),{components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`You probably wouldn\u2019t sit down to a meal with your dog at the table every day, but that doesn\u2019t mean you can\u2019t enjoy a nice home-cooked meal with your pup. Dogs are social animals, so they love spending time with their owners and other people. But they also have their weird quirks, like begging at the table or jumping up to get snacks.
Luckily, it\u2019s not hard to train your dog to stop begging at the table and other bad habits. They just take some patience and dedication to follow through on commands until your dog gets it. With these tips, you can crack down on those weird doggy habits and help them learn new things that will last a lifetime. Read on for advice on how to train your dog to stop begging at the table and other tricks as well as tricks from nutritionist Victoria SchENDler`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: From First Date to Soulmate: How to Know If You're on the Right Track

But getting past these awkward initial stages and finding a potential partner who you can connect with on a deeper level is no mean feat. Figuring out if someone is your soulmate or simply the first step to becoming one isn\u2019t easy. Even though it can feel like we\u2019re constantly being bombarded with images of fairy tale love and meet-cute romances, dating in real life isn\u2019t always so straightforward. Unless you\u2019re living under a rock, you probably know that letting somebody into your private world isn\u2019t something to take lightly.
But how do you know if you\u2019re on the right track when it comes to dating? Whether you\u2019ve just met someone new and want to get to know them better without rushing things or have been seeing somebody for some time and are wondering if they could be The One, here are some signs that could indicate that this person may be more than just a casual partner\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Working

If your partner usually leaves for work before you even get out of bed, or isn\u2019t home until after you\u2019re already in bed, things can get tricky.
Working from home, flexible hours and remote working are all buzzwords in today\u2019s labor market. Companies are becoming increasingly aware that it isn\u2019t just about how much time employees spend at the desk but also about what they achieve during that time. A Gallup poll found that telecommuting or working from home is growing in popularity among professionals across most industries. Working remotely makes it easier to find jobs, negotiate schedules and live without a commute.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation?

var u=Object.defineProperty,p=Object.defineProperties;var h=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var c=(e,i,o)=>i in e?u(e,i,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[i]=o,a=(e,i)=>{for(var o in i||(i={}))s.call(i,o)&&c(e,o,i[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(i))r.call(i,o)&&c(e,o,i[o]);return e},l=(e,i)=>p(e,h(i));var d=(e,i)=>{var o={};for(var t in e)s.call(e,t)&&i.indexOf(t)<0&&(o[t]=e[t]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var t of n(e))i.indexOf(t)<0&&r.call(e,t)&&(o[t]=e[t]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var t=o,{components:e}=t,i=d(t,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(a(a({},layoutProps),i),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Mediation has been practiced across cultures for thousands of years. It is a process that brings people together to resolve conflict and find mutually satisfying solutions. In mediation, an impartial third party assists the disputing parties in identifying the issues, exploring their own role in it and accessing their core needs to come up with a solution that works for all parties involved.
Mediation is a confidential process and there are many types of mediation depending on the nature of conflict. For example, dispute resolution could be focusing on specific issues such as environmental concerns or human resources issues; it could be between two parties such as divorce mediation or landlord-tenant mediation; it could be on a particular topic like civil rights mediation or criminal mediation; or it could be based on certain factors like age, gender, sexual orientation or physical ability. The following article explores the ways in which mediation can help you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Tips for Eating Healthy on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
var y=Object.defineProperty,d=Object.defineProperties;var g=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var h=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var l=(e,o,t)=>o in e?y(e,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[o]=t,i=(e,o)=>{for(var t in o||(o={}))h.call(o,t)&&l(e,t,o[t]);if(n)for(var t of n(o))s.call(o,t)&&l(e,t,o[t]);return e},u=(e,o)=>d(e,g(o));var r=(e,o)=>{var t={};for(var a in e)h.call(e,a)&&o.indexOf(a)<0&&(t[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var a of n(e))o.indexOf(a)<0&&s.call(e,a)&&(t[a]=e[a]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var a=t,{components:e}=a,o=r(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,u(i(i({},layoutProps),o),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Are you trying to eat healthier but find that healthy foods are expensive? Are you trying to make a good meal last for several days and not just one? Are you struggling to find affordable, healthy options near your home or work? If so, you\u2019re not alone. Eating healthy can be expensive and challenging. The cost of healthy food has gone up while the cost of unhealthy food has gone down. But this doesn\u2019t mean that eating healthy is impossible; it just means we all need to get a little bit more creative.
Eating well on a budget can be challenging, but it isn\u2019t impossible. Making smart choices about what you buy as well as how you cook your food can make a big difference in how much money you spend on food each month and how healthy your diet is at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
